newsitem.title: USA: Restrac sees Q1 net loss $0.02-$0.03/shr.
newsitem.headline: Restrac sees Q1 net loss $0.02-$0.03/shr.

text.p: Restrac Inc said Thursday it expected to post a net loss for the first quarter of between $0.02 and $0.03 per share on projected revenues of about $4.7 million.
The company, which designs, develops and markets human resource staffing software, said it expected the quarter's net loss would be in the range of $200,000 to $300,000.
Restrac President and Chief Executive Lars Perkins said it appears as though the company's "sales cycles are lengthening."

"At the present time, we believe that this is caused by a number of factors including, sales productivity, the number of new choices available to automate the staffing process and uncertainty created by the continuous re-engineering of the (human resources) function," he added.
Figures for the comparable period in the prior year were not immediately available.
